column4: Can anyone offer any guidance on the correct config for my xorg.conf file?
What display adapter are you using?
What does xrandr  say?  Show us:  xrandr | pastebinit  #And send resulting URL here.
Are you using a KVM switch?
Do you have a /etc/X11/xorg.conf file now?   (ls /etc/X11/xorg.conf )
And then:  sudo service gdm restart

I logged into the main console (not into X) and ran X -configure as root.  It  created an xorg.conf.new file in /root, which I then copied to /etc/X11/xorg.conf after updating it with the display modes
Did you try running it without an xorg.conf file?
Just tried what you said and it's still the same i.e. only 800x600 available
Look at the output of /var/log/Xorg.0.log   and see what driver it is using.
I believe I am using the R128 driver
